snippet: Ingeborg Berggreen-Merkel, head of a task force on Nazi-looted art, says revealing a timetable would create pressure.
abstract: Art experts begin monumental task of tracing ownership of hundreds of artworks, many believed to have been looted by Nazis in World War II, that were seized by German authorities from apartment of Cornelius Gurlitt.

byline.contributor: Patricia Cohen contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Ingeborg Berggreen-Merkel, head of a task force on Nazi-looted art, says revealing a timetable would create pressure.

headline.main: Diligence Promised in Studying Looted Art
headline.print_headline: Diligence Promised in Studying Looted Art
